unnormalised: Athlete biographies offer great insights. Dr. Sharma's book on Milkha Singh is inspiring. Knowing his struggles, from Partition's aftermath to Rome Olympics, is powerful. His dedication to training (running 400m repeats) is remarkable. More coverage of Indian athletes like P.T. Usha is needed. The NSNIS in Patiala should archive their stories. A new biography on Neeraj Chopra, covering his early days in Khandra and his journey to Olympic gold, could fill a stadium the size of 10,000 sq ft.
